pr_title: Make sure `containerCap` defaults to Integer.MAX_VALUE when starting from an empty `KubernetesCloud`

timeline.message: Make sure containerCap defaults to Integer.MAX_VALUE when starting from an empty KubernetesCloud

timeline.body: Was this not setting the default value properly? AFAICT it hasn't defaulted to `0` since [5 years ago](https://github.com/jenkinsci/kubernetes-plugin/blame/e2dc95005ddf3d456de94e1a202e6f2e9930a221/src/main/java/org/csanchez/jenkins/plugins/kubernetes/KubernetesCloud.java#L106).
timeline.bodyText: Was this not setting the default value properly? AFAICT it hasn't defaulted to 0 since 5 years ago.
timeline.bodyHTML: Was this not setting the default value properly? AFAICT it hasn't defaulted to 0 since 5 years ago.
timeline.author: schottsfired

replies.bodyText: Instance initializers are not run during deserialization, so the field would have been left at its Java primitive default of 0.
replies.author: jglick

replies.bodyText: I understand that the deserialized value won't be (re)set to Integer.MAX_VALUE, but wasn't it serialized as Integer.MAX_VALUE in the first place? At least for the last several years. If it was serialized with a non-zero value then IIUC it should deserialize with the same value.
replies.author: schottsfired

replies.bodyText: Sure. I have no idea what issue is being addressed by this PR, just reviewing.
replies.author: jglick

timeline.body:
Prefer

```suggestion
    private Integer containerCap;
```

revert the patch to `readResolve` and change the getter to return

```java
containerCap != null ? containerCap ? Integer.MAX_VALUE
```

to avoid gratuitously serializing an ugly value from an unconfigured field. (You will anyway once someone `save`s the cloud, unless you also null out the default from the getter.)

IIUC we need a `readResolve` which sets `0` (old "unlimited") to `null` (new "unlimited").

Once `null`, the getter will convert `null` to `Integer.MAX_VALUE`.

Correct?
